{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the provided documents, there is no evidence to support the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 through breast milk. Multiple studies have found no presence of SARS-CoV-2 RNA in breast milk samples from infected mothers. Additionally, there have been no reports of infants contracting COVID-19 through breastfeeding. Some studies have even detected antibodies against SARS-CoV-2 in breast milk, which could potentially provide protection to the infant. Therefore, the answer is B. no.", "answer_choice": "B"}
